image.altText: A close up of an older woman wearing a black chef's hat and apron reading 'Nonna's Cucina'

props.synopsis: The Port Adelaide Magistrates Court hears Francesco Dimasi, who is charged with murdering his 85-year-old wife in Adelaide's west, was heavily intoxicated on the night he allegedly killed his wife. WARNING: This story contains distressing details.

title.children: Adelaide man accused of murdering Maria Dimasi phoned police on the night of her death, court hears

image.altText: A medium photo of a middle-aged man with receding hair and beard, wearing a singlet and glasses

props.synopsis: A man released from immigration detention as a result of a recent High Court ruling is charged with two counts of indecent assault.

title.children: Man released from immigration detention after High Court ruling charged with indecent assault

image.altText: Six police officers carry a casket

props.synopsis: Slain SA Police officer Brevet Sergeant Jason Doig has been remembered as kind, caring and a "much loved" member of his community, in a public funeral at the Adelaide Convention Centre.

title.children: 'Extraordinary sacrifice' of SA police officer killed in line of duty commemorated at public funeral

image.altText: People hold up signs and chant at a protest.

props.synopsis: The Australian Education Union's executive recommends its members accept the revised enterprise agreement, which would deliver pay rises over four years, to avoid a third strike in as many months.

title.children: Education union and SA government reach agreement on teacher pay increase

image.altText: A brunette woman poses with a cat - smiling.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman accused of attempting to smother a paralysed man who was recovering at a rehabilitation centre from a separate alleged axe attack, is released on bail.

title.children: Woman told to stop taking medication so she could 'plead insanity' before attempted smothering, court hears

image.altText: Peta Murphy smiles while standing in her electorate office

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, announces the death of Victorian Labor MP Peta Murphy, praising the contribution the 50-year-old made to public life.

title.children: Prime minister says government 'broken-hearted' following death of Peta Murphy

image.altText: Map of Queensland and the Coral Sea showing possible cyclone paths.

props.synopsis: The BOM says a tropical low over the Solomon Islands is likely to develop into a severe storm that might head our way.

title.children: Potential cyclone brewing over Coral Sea could cross Australian coast

image.altText: Penny Wong shakes hands with French Foreign Minister Catherine Colonna in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Both countries want to reset relationships that soured when Australia ditched a lucrative multi-billion dollar submarine contract with the French company Naval Group so it could join AUKUS.

title.children: Australia strengthens regional defence ties with France with both countries keen to move on from AUKUS controversy

image.altText: Two chefs smiling with food

props.synopsis: A 91-year-old man has been charged with murder and refused bail after his wife was found dead at a home in Adelaide's western suburbs over the weekend.

title.children: 91-year-old man charged over alleged murder of 'loved' nonna

image.altText: Anna Hennessy and Aiden Marks

props.synopsis: Busting myths and stereotypes about Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) is important as it helps people to avoid making assumptions, write Anna Hennessy and Aiden Marks.

title.children: 'You don't look autistic': The reality of Autism Spectrum Disorder

image.altText: Mount Marapi volcano spews a huge thick grey cloud of volcanic ash into a grey sky.

props.synopsis: Rescuers find more survivors and recover bodies but further search efforts are suspended after another small eruption at Mount Marapi, which has been active since January.

title.children: Climbers killed, survivors found after Indonesia volcano erupts

image.altText: A man with scruffy hair squints while taking a selfie in bushland.

props.synopsis: Albert Thorn was "at the heart" of the savage assault and murder of Bradley Lyons in 2018. He will be nearing 90 by the time he is eligible for parole.

title.children: Vigilante who kidnapped, tortured and executed Victorian dad sentenced to life behind bars

image.altText: The helm of a USS warship looking out into the Mediterranean Sea

props.synopsis: Attacks on shipping in the southern Red Sea have heightened fears of the Israel-Gaza war spreading, with the US military saying three commercial ships were attacked by Yemen's Iran-allied Houthi movement.

title.children: Who are Yemen's Houthi rebels, and what part are they playing is the Israel-Gaza war?

image.altText: An older woman passing a netball on an outdoor netball court. Behind her the sky is blue. She has white hair.

props.synopsis: Walking netball is enabling people of all ages and abilities to get on the court. But it could also be a key to tackling loneliness, especially in regional Australia.

title.children: Rule changes let netballers 'never laugh so much' as they play the game they love

image.altText: A brown rabbit with a white tail leaps into the air above green grass.

props.synopsis: Australia's rabbit population has boomed during these past wet years, but drying conditions should finally give landholders a chance to fight back.

title.children: Rabbit numbers have boomed in recent years. Here's how the looming El Niño dry might change that

image.altText: Clare O'Neil speaks in Question Time

props.synopsis: For weeks now the federal government has been wrestling with what to do about scores of immigration detainees it was forced into releasing. So what's the proposed preventative detention regime?

title.children: How will the new 'preventative detention' regime for released immigration detainees work?

image.altText: A large contingent of police in a car park next to a police vehicle.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old who sparked fears of an American-style school shooting pleads guilty to endangering the lives of staff and students at Atlantis Beach Baptist College in Perth's north.

title.children: Boy who told triple-0 operator he was going to kill people admits firing shots into Perth school

image.altText: Two images put together, left side Richard in work uniform, right side Richard in a hospital gown.

props.synopsis: Pathologist Richard Scolyer's colleagues have designed a high-stakes experiment to fight his brain tumour, using the very treatment they pioneered for melanoma.

title.children: Faced with 'certain death', pathologist Richard Scolyer is undergoing an experimental treatment

image.altText: School students

props.synopsis: Strengthened sexual consent education is now part of the Australian curriculum for all schools, and while non-government schools have some discretion in its implementation, the head of Catholic Education Tasmania has criticised the way consent is included in the national curriculum.

title.children: 'Amoral': Catholic education head takes issue with national sexual consent curriculum

image.altText: palestinian men and boys stand on a heap of rubble looking for survivors

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says it has expanded its ground offensive to "every part" of the Gaza strip, as civilians crowd into an ever-shrinking area in the south of the enclave.

title.children: Civilians flee to south in search of safety as 'every part' of Gaza strip comes under attack

image.altText: a man in a high-vis jacket loading cattle from a truck to a ship.

props.synopsis: The group from northern Australia's cattle industry has been negotiating with the federal government over the compensation figure for three years, and has twice knocked back an offer of $215 million.

title.children: Cattle industry seeking up to $900 million to settle live export ban class action

image.altText: Man on the phone in an office in front of two desktop computer screens

props.synopsis: Australians are already losing work to AI, but the impact so far has been largely hidden from view. But not to people like Benjamin, whose job was replaced by a chatbot.

title.children: 'We all got AI-ed': The Australian jobs being lost to AI under the radar

image.altText: House in Brisbane suburb of Stafford with mailbox out the front.

props.synopsis: Applying the logic of JobKeeper to create a HomeKeeper program could save a lot of working-class mortgagors from losing their homes, writes Chris Wallace.

title.children: You've heard about JobKeeper, now we need HomeKeeper

image.altText: The Australian men's cricket team celebrate on a stage, as the captain holds the trophy after a tournament win.

props.synopsis: In the wake of the success of the recent Cricket World Cup, the ICC agrees a deal with Amazon's Prime Video to give the streaming service the exclusive Australian rights to broadcast all ICC tournaments for the next four years.

title.children: ICC signs exclusive Australian streaming deal with Amazon's Prime Video for rights to ICC tournaments

image.altText: A group of men in black wearing balaclavas walk behind a banner.

props.synopsis: The "unplanned demonstration" took place as the city was celebrating the 169th anniversary of the Eureka Stockade.

title.children: White supremacist march 'really has no place in Ballarat', mayor says as police probe banned Nazi salute

image.altText: A man with a wreath on his head stands on a podium with a medal

props.synopsis: A magistrate refuses bail for Olympic rowing silver medallist Simon Burgess who has been charged with domestic violence offences in Tasmania.

title.children: Olympic rower in custody on domestic violence charges after magistrate refuses bail

image.altText: A young girl with pigtails plays on the sand at the beach.

props.synopsis: An ACT Coroner's Court inquest is considering mistakes made by Canberra Hospital staff that delayed the diagnosis of five-year-old Canberra girl Rozalia Spadafora before her death.

title.children: 'Do not have time to go back': Triage nurse defends not taking 5yo Rozalia Spadafora's blood pressure before her death

image.altText: Couple in wedding outfits stands in the doorway

props.synopsis: An "out-of-body experience" set Max Simensen on a course to changing his life and living authentically. He shares what he has learnt along the way.

title.children: When Max affirmed his gender a decade ago, he didn't expect changing bathrooms to bring so many insights

image.altText: A young couple stand on the verandah of their weatherboard home.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government received more than 4,000 submissions after unveiling a proposal for the 54km project around Toowoomba in July. Now it's been canned.

title.children: 'Tears of joy' after controversial highway project set to affect 81 homes scrapped

image.altText: Josh Taylor holds up a fish

props.synopsis: The 25-year-old man who was buried by sand on Bribie Island, in Queensland's Moreton Bay, on Saturday afternoon has been identified.

title.children: Man remains in critical condition after being buried alive in sand on Bribie Island

image.altText: Rebecca Taylor leaves an IBAC hearing in Melbourne with an unidentified woman.

props.synopsis: The judge says the pair took on the "tedious but lucrative task" of filling in forms with false information to ensure they were paid by the institutions for training not delivered.

title.children: Mother-daughter duo who scammed TAFEs out of millions of dollars sentenced

image.altText: Roofs of new homes at a new housing estate.

props.synopsis: Australian property values are expected to stabilise as more homes come up for sale and buyers remain wary of high borrowing costs. Here's how your capital city fared in November.

title.children: Australia's median property price is now at a record high. Here's what's happening in your capital city

image.altText: a large truck with a dozen people posing in front of it

props.synopsis: The truck was full of bedding, furniture and toys for a charity sale to support farmers affected by bushfires near Tara on Queensland's Western Downs.

title.children: Thieves 'badly damage' Drought Angels truck loaded with donations for Queensland farmers affected by bushfires

image.altText: Composite shot of Beyoncé against a wall of mirrors (left) and Osher Günsberg against a backdrop of roses.

props.synopsis: All the entertainment news you need — from the viral horror game taking over YouTube, to the rundown on the three Bachelors looking for love.

title.children: Beyoncé breaks cinema record, The Oscars race begins, 20 years of The Simple Life and more

image.altText: A hand holding a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Telstra apologises after a faulty part leaves business owners and residents in a north west NSW town in a service blackout.

title.children: Anger as six-day Telstra outage forces businesses to close and residents to stock up on Optus sim cards
